Displaying File History: stcmd hist

Use stcmd hist to display the revision history of files.

Syntax

stcmd hist -p "projectSpecifier" [-pwdfile "filePath"] [-cmp] [-csf] [-encrypt encryptionType] [-cfgl "labelName" | -cfgp "stateName" | -cfgd "asOfDate"] [-is] [-q] [-x] [-stop] [-rp "folderPath" | -fp "folderPath"] [-filter "fileStatus"] [files...]

Example

The following example uses stcmd hist to display the revision history of the file star.h in SourceCode, a child of the root folder StarDraw (in the StarDraw view of the StarDraw project).

stcmd hist -p "JMarsh:password@Orion:49201/StarDraw/StarDraw/SourceCode" "star.h"

 

For more information, see Using Common stcmd Options.
